fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43505].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The *Spaces* menu in the top bar has a drop-down which shows each space of the instance. However, when we minimize the window of the browser so that the _Spaces_ item shows inside the *More* drop-down list, the *Spaces* button loses it's drop list.

The interesting part here is that if the Spaces menu is working and we minimize it, the list will still show up even though the Spaces button is under *More*. However, if we refresh the page the list is gone. The same happens if the problem is occurring and you maximize the window so that the spaces gets back to the top bar, the problem still happens until the page gets refreshed.

h3. Environment
* Happens with any browser in any OS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the dashboard page in a browser;
# Check that the Spaces drop-down menu works;
# Minimize the page so that the Spaces button goes under the *More* button, becoming accessible through the More drop-down list;
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
* The Spaces button inside the *More* list should show the list of the spaces just like it shows before refreshing the page.
!Working1.png|thumbnail!
!Working2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
* The Spaces button doesn't have the drop list to show the spaces.
!NotWorking1.png|thumbnail!
!NotWorking2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* There's no error entries in the logs and neither network errors in the developer tools of the browser.
* I noticed that the CSS class is different when the Spaces button is in the top bar compared to when it's under the More button. Thus when we refresh the page the Browser's cache gets overwritten with the new class that doesn't have the drop list.

h3. Workaround
# Keep the window big enough so that the Spaces menu doesn't go under the *More* button;
# Zoom out the page so that the Spaces menu doesn't go under the *More* button.
fields.summary: Spaces Dropdown Menu Doens't Show When It's Under the More Menu

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Users that contains specific special characters in the username will not be able to create any content in Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla Confluence 5.10.3
 # Add a new user. Name this user userhashtag#
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Login as this user
 # Drop down from "Spaces" and clcik the "Create Space"

h3. Expected Results

The space creation dialogue pops up
h3. Actual Results

There is an error message displayed in the UI : "Your session has expired. Please reload the page to try again."
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Nothing is in the logs

h3. Notes
This issue has been observed with the following characters:
# '#"
# '/'
# '?'

(!) If users are being synchronized from an external directory like JIRA or LDAP that Confluence will successfully synchronize and create the user and allow the user to log in, but they will experience this bug.

h3. Workaround
Edit the username to not contain any special characters
fields.summary: Special Characters in username prevents them from creating a new space/new page with the message "Your session has expired. Please reload the page to try again."

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence Cloud, it is possible for a Confluence administrator to remove the *Confluence administrator* global permission for all user groups which prevents any user from performing admin actions in Confluence and revert back this issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Confluence administrator, it would be better if I was prevented from removing the *Confluence administrator* global permission for the last user group that has this permission (not counting the *confluence-administrators* and *system-administrators* groups are they are reserved for Atlassian Support in Cloud).
A warning could also be displayed in case users are about to lose this permission as the only way to get it back is via Atlassian Support.
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, if users lose the *Confluence administrator* permissions in Confluence Cloud, they will need to create a ticket to Atlassian Support so we can grant this permission back.
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like to be prevented from removing the last Confluence administrator group

h3. Problem Definition
The fix introduced for [CONF-40499|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40499] implements a flag that will indicate when the client-side Page Properties Report macro cannot be rendered and will trigger a page refresh that requests server-side rendering adding {{&pagepropertiesreport.serverrender}} to the URL. Details of the fix are described in: [CONF-40499 Degrade to server-side rendering if page properties report cannot be rendered client-side|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-masterdetail-plugin/pull-requests/58/conf-40499-degrade-to-server-side/diff],

A solution that doesn't require loading the page twice
fields.summary: Server-side rendering bug fix not optimized for large pages

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43408].
  {panel}

h5. Problem statement

In Confluence 5.10 onwards, we introduced batched notifications. However, the documentation is not clear on what actions are included in the batched notifications and what actions will result in an e-mail to be sent out immediately.

More info on the feature here: [Confluence 5.10 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.10+Release+Notes#Confluence5.10ReleaseNotes-Moretimeforeveryone].
h5. Suggested solution

Please update the documentation to mention the kinds of actions are part of the batched notifications and which are not.

For example, adding an attachment to the page (not the body of the page) or adding an inline comment to an attachment will immediately send out an e-mail to users watching the page/space. Editing the page content, however, will wait until the next batch window to send out the batched notifications e-mail to users.
fields.summary: Document the actions that will be included in the batched notifications

h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a PAGE

# Create 5 subpages under Page 1
# Create Page 2 under PAGE

# Add another Children Display macro to PAGE (parent page: Page 2)

h3. Actual Results
* Clicking the link doesn't bring you to the section of the page. URL link does not contain any anchor to the section of the page.
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The reason for the absence of anchors in the TOC could be the lack of the "id" field in the h2 HTML that is generated for Children Display pages, as shown in the screenshots below:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

Contrary to what was explained in issue [CONF-42832|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42832], a Table of contents Zone does not work around the problem.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43401].
  {panel}

We're no longer permission-checking links on pages to other Confluence pages. We previously did this to determine if the reader had permission to see the linked page, and would link to the page ID rather than its name in cases where the reader didn't have permission to see the linked page. Given that a determined user could use the REST API to determine the name of the linked page anyway, and that the permission check comes at a performance cost, we've decided the cost of this check is too great when balanced with any perceived benefit.

This change currently only affects Confluence Cloud.

If you have comments or concerns about this, please let us know by commenting.

Thanks,

The Confluence Team
fields.summary: Change to link permission check when rendering pages

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence allows us to add as many pinned comments to attachments like PDFs as we want.

However, due to a limitation in REST API, it can only load 100 of these, so adding more than 100 will cause these to not be loaded the next time the attachment is opened, even though they are present in the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
Two changes:
# Prevent users from adding more than 100 pinned comments to a single version of an attachment.
# Add this limitation to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Share+and+Comment+on+Files]

We really like the confluence roadmap planner.  Although I realize that it does not have an official API, we still found it reasonably straightforward to extract data from JIRA and our other tracking systems and automatically create custom roadmaps that help us understand how our work rolls up across 30 scrum teams.  (Note that the JIRA product roadmap tool will not work for us because we also need to display custom operational data, for which we use confluence's chart functionality to get it all into one place.)

In order to understand how the work rolls up, we define two levels of epic - larger ones that span across teams and smaller ones that belong to one team.  We really would like to be able to show the larger and smaller epics together in the same lane but in different colors so that someone viewing the page is clear that these are different things.  Different colors would also help us convey other levels of information - for example, the product or target release for an epic, or which team is actually working on it.

Note that this is *not* a request to support individual bar colors in the UI.  I realize that would likely end up being more work and introducing potential usability problems.  This request is just to support optionally including a color as part of the JSON data for the bar and displaying the bar in that color if it is present.

The lane is already being used to group related items together, so we would prefer not to have to separate these issues into different lanes.
fields.summary: Allow Roadmap Planner JSON data to support colors per-bar

h3. Summary
Attempting to edit page restrictions when a large number of users are listed prevents the changes from being saved. This appears to be due to Confluence putting the full list of user numbers in the http header, which means the size exceeds the maximum default for Tomcat (4KB), which causes Confluence to return a 404 page not found.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Edit the page restrictions, add 61 users to view permission and 61 users to view/edit permission
# Try to apply the restriction change

h3. Expected Results
The modification should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
It is showing an error on the restriction popup without any detail message.
{quote}
There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later. 
{quote}
See HAR findings in private comment below

h3.Workaround
As a short term workaround solution, you can either chose to use a group instead of individual users, or increase the header size limitation on both Tomcat and at the proxy level.
fields.summary: Unable to set page restrictions due to large number of user keys in http header

h5.Steps to reproduce
# Insert a JIRA Chart Macro
# Use a JQL query that takes about 5 or so seconds to produce a pie chart
# Click "Insert"

h5.Expected Results
I have some indication that I have inserted a macro, and the macro is processing

There is no indication that a macro has been inserted, until the macro finishes processing

If the macro takes more than 10 seconds to process, then it will fail entirely due to a hard 10 second time out on macro processing in the editor.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43327].
  {panel}

Using assistive technologies, such as a screen reader and Chrome extensions, we believe there is currently an issue, not necessarily a bug, with the headings provided in the editor.

By default the main page title / heading is a HTML H1 tag, which is correct as it's the main heading. However, when it comes to formatting the sub-headings within the main edit area / section(s), which are subordinate / lesser than the main page heading, H1 is provided as an option.

There is an argument that this is correct, and provides flexibility for all users, but as the majority of our users don't fully understand accessibility and heading structures, they simply start with Heading 1 and go from there; it therefore becomes an education element for our staff of recommended page editing and formatting options. We were therefore wondering how many other people are unknowingly affected by this; especially because visually you have two different styles for a H1 tag.

We try to create each Confluence page to one subject, minimising the overall length of a page so that it's easy to read and understand; converting long pages into separate individual pages. Multiple H1 headings should therefore not be used in our installation, hence why we would like an option to remove "Heading 1" from the drop-down list; or behind the scenes in the HTML code "Heading 1" actually gets converted to a H2, "Heading 2" becomes a H3 HTML tag, etc.

We welcome yours, and others, thoughts on this subject.
fields.summary: Accessibility - Confluence Headings and their corresponding HTML tags

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43247].
  {panel}

In Confluence 5.7 we had the "Notify Watchers" checkbox always on by default. In Confluence 5.8 we had the "Notify Watchers" last setting remembered on any page. In Confluence 5.9 we have the "Notify Watchers" last setting remembered on the same page. 

I think it's clear by now that no single notification default strategy is going to be acceptable to everyone. In my company we like notifications and don't want to make it too easy for people to forget to send them. In other companies they want fewer emails and prefer to nudge people towards not sending them unless they're needed.

Please implement configuration options at the site and space and possibly also page level to control the *default behaviour* of the Notify Watchers checkbox. Options could be:
* always on
* always off
* remember user's last setting within the site
* remember user's last setting within the space
* remember user's last setting for the page

Let's give up on finding a single strategy that works for everyone - there is no such thing. You will make a lot more people happy by providing a way to accommodate differing requirements.
fields.summary: Configurable default behaviour for Notify Watchers checkbox

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43245].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, site admins are restricted from administering the personal spaces. Though site admin could login as the users to delete the personal spaces but users will recieve an email that their admin has logged in under their account.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Site Admin permission to administer Personal Spaces:
* View Space Permission and page restrictions
* Delete personal spaces

h3. Workaround
* Go to *User Management*
* Look for the user and  click on the name once you found it
* Choose *Login as user* from the top-right corner
* Go to the personal space and perform the deletion

Another workaround below is applicable when you cannot *Login as user*: [^snippet.js].
fields.summary: Site Admin's permission should not be restricted for Personal Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43239].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a customer searches for a content through the Customer Portal and access a page that contains the Content Report Table macro, if he select the *find more results* it will return an error message *access denied*.

The find more results is a search: label = X and spacekey = Y where the customer should have access once he have access to this space.
{code:java}
dosearchsite.action?queryString=labelText:(atlassian)+AND+spacekey:(TEST)&type=page,blog{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a *Service Desk Project* with a linked *Confluence Space*.
 # Go to *Service Desk Project Settings* > *Knowledge base*
 # Select *Link to a Confluence space*
 # Select Confluence
 # Select the created space.
 # Mark the box *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*
 # Create 3 confluence pages on the new space
 # Insert the label *atlassian* and a *Content Report Table* macro in each page.
 ** Macro settings: Label(s) *atlassian* / Space(s) *your space key* / Maximum Number of Pages *2*
 # Create a Service Desk customer.
 # Log in as this customer.
 # Access the customer portal.
 # Search for *atlassian*.
 # Select any result (the selected page must contain the *Content Report Table* macro.
 # Select *Find more results*.
 # You will be redirected to an access denied page.

!43239.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * Confluence 1000.163.0
 * JIRA Service Desk 3.3.0-OD-01-003

h3. Expected results.

The find more results should display more macro results.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Find more results of Content Report Table macro not working for customers.

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence audit log currently has only REST API. In order to get the information about the logged changes the external system (or script) require to has:
 # Scheduled requests
 # Credentials of the admin user

While the second point is not secure the first point can cause additional load to REST API.
h3. Suggested Solution
 # Introduce webhooks for Confluence Server
 # Create a documentation on creating webhooks for Confluence Audit Log.

h3. Workaround

The only possible approaches at the moment are to use the web interface or [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest-server/#audit].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43234].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up JIRA and Confluence
 # Enable JIRA User Server, and allow Confluence to connect to it
 ** When defining the directory, set the directory as read only
 # As a user from the JIRA directory, attempt to reset your password

_Note: the above steps for reproduction are also applicable to Crowd._
h5. Expected Results

Because the directory is read-only, the password cannot be reset. A message similar to the following would be helpful:
{quote}
Your account is managed by <application name>, and cannot be updated at Confluence. Please visit <application url> to make changes to your account. If you're having trouble, please consult your system administrators.
{quote}
This lets the user know their account cannot be changed at the current application, and where to go for managing it.
 * We know the directory is read-only
 * We also know which directory a user logs in through
 * We're also aware of where that directory is located (since we have this configuration as a part of the directory)

h5. Actual Results
The update fails, and the following message appears:
{quote}
An internal error occured when trying to change your password.
{quote}
Users must contact the administrator, rather than being able to self-service.
h5. Workaround

Setting the directory Read/Write allows users to reset their passwords in Crowd and JIRA from a downstream application such as Confluence. However, there are some cases where this may not be desirable - Confluence should fail gracefully, and guide the user to a location where they can change their password.
fields.summary: When using a read only Crowd/JIRA Directory, users attempting to change their password get an unhelpful error message
